<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 278, 170, 293]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 298, 329, 313]]<|/det|>
Paper 6 Alternative to Practical  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 278, 905, 293]]<|/det|>
0625/61

October/November 2018

1 hour

Candidates answer on the Question Paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 359, 368, 374]]<|/det|>
No Additional Materials are required.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 390, 388, 407]]<|/det|>
## READ THESE INSTRUCTIONS FIRST  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 416, 719, 432]]<|/det|>
Write your Centre number, candidate number and name on all the work you hand in.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 432, 325, 446]]<|/det|>
Write in dark blue or black pen.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 446, 502, 461]]<|/det|>
You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 460, 504, 475]]<|/det|>
Do not use staples, paper clips, glue or correction fluid.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 475, 380, 490]]<|/det|>
DO NOT WRITE IN ANY BARCODES.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 501, 255, 515]]<|/det|>
Answer all questions.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 515, 361, 530]]<|/det|>
Electronic calculators may be used.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 530, 767, 545]]<|/det|>
You may lose marks if you do not show your working or if you do not use appropriate units.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 555, 604, 570]]<|/det|>
At the end of the examination, fasten all your work securely together.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 570, 759, 585]]<|/det|>
The number of marks is given in brackets [ ] at the end of each question or part question.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 96, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 727, 91]]<|/det|>
A student is determining the spring constant \(k\) of a spring by two methods.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 468, 121]]<|/det|>
Fig. 1.2 shows how the apparatus is used.

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 134, 203, 152]]<|/det|>
# Method 1

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 165, 146, 184]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 165, 714, 184]]<|/det|>
On Fig. 1.1, measure the unstretched length \(l_0\) of the spring, in mm.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[363, 198, 638, 348]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[462, 365, 532, 384]]<|/det|>
<mark>[b]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[561, 427, 920, 446]]<|/det|>
<form>l_0 = .................................................... mm [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 459, 146, 477]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 459, 702, 477]]<|/det|>
The student attaches the spring to the clamp as shown in Fig. 1.2.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 489, 470, 508]]<|/det|>
He hangs a \(300\mathrm{g}\) mass on the spring.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[139, 521, 856, 826]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 841, 534, 860]]<|/det|>
<mark>[b]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 873, 517, 892]]<|/det|>
He measures the new length \(l\) of the spring.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[571, 917, 920, 937]]<|/det|>
<form>l = ............................53 ....................... mm

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 181, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 72, 752, 91]]<|/det|>
Calculate the extension \(e\) of the spring using the equation \(e = l - l_0\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[566, 150, 920, 168]]<|/det|>
<form>e = .................................................... mm [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 180, 180, 199]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 178, 897, 205]]<|/det|>
Calculate a value for the spring constant \(k\) using the equation \(k = \frac{F}{\theta}\), where \(F = 3.0 \text{N}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[566, 259, 920, 277]]<|/det|>
<form>k = ................................................. N/mm [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 291, 205, 308]]<|/det|>
<label>Method 2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 322, 144, 339]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 320, 920, 355]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 510, 534, 529]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[567, 571, 920, 590]]<|/det|>
<form>t = ............................................................ [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[566, 667, 920, 686]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 808, 89]]<|/det|>
A student is determining the refractive index \(n\) of the material of a transparent block.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 594, 121]]<|/det|>
Fig. 3.1 shows the outline \(\mathbf{ABCD}\) of the transparent block.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 133, 845, 780]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 823, 532, 841]]<|/det|>
<mark>[Fig. 3.1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 191, 90]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[201, 72, 297, 90]]<|/det|>
On Fig. 3.1:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 102, 574, 122]]<|/det|>
• draw a normal **NL** at the centre of side **AB**

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 134, 767, 152]]<|/det|>
• continue the normal so that it passes through side **CD** of the block

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 165, 544, 183]]<|/det|>
• label the point \(\mathbf{F}\) where **NL** crosses **AB**

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 196, 551, 214]]<|/det|>
• label the point \(\mathbf{G}\) where **NL** crosses **CD**.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 197, 920, 214]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[148, 227, 181, 245]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 227, 836, 245]]<|/det|>
Draw a line \(\mathbf{EF}\) at an angle \(i = 30^{\circ}\) to the left of the normal and above side \(\mathbf{AB}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 227, 920, 245]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 257, 181, 275]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 257, 920, 291]]<|/det|>
Mark the positions of two pins \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\) on line \(\mathbf{EF}\) placed at a suitable distance apart for this type of ray-tracing experiment.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 272, 920, 291]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 304, 146, 322]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 303, 920, 338]]<|/det|>
The student observes the images of \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\) through side \(\mathbf{CD}\) of the block so that the images of \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\) appear one behind the other.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 350, 920, 384]]<|/det|>
He places two pins \(\mathsf{P}_{3}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{4}\) between his eye and the block so that \(\mathsf{P}_{3}, \mathsf{P}_{4}\) and the images of \(\mathsf{P}_{1}\) and \(\mathsf{P}_{2}\) seen through the block, appear one behind the other.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 396, 574, 415]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 428, 181, 446]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 475, 767, 492]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 920, 121]]<|/det|>
A student is investigating the relationship between the power produced by an electrical heater and the time taken to heat a beaker of water. The power of the heater is given by the equation \(P = VI\), where \(V\) is the potential difference (p.d.) across the heater and \(I\) is the current in the heater.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 134, 920, 167]]<|/det|>
Plan an experiment to investigate the relationship between the power produced by an electrical heater and the time taken to heat a beaker of water.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 180, 420, 198]]<|/det|>
The following apparatus is available:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 212, 235, 227]]<|/det|>
ammeter

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 228, 235, 242]]<|/det|>
voltmeter

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 242, 400, 259]]<|/det|>
0–12 V variable power supply

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 258, 285, 273]]<|/det|>
250 cm³ beaker

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 274, 212, 288]]<|/det|>
heater

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 289, 266, 304]]<|/det|>
thermometer

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 305, 250, 320]]<|/det|>
stopwatch

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 335, 920, 368]]<|/det|>
The student can also use other apparatus and materials that are usually available in a school laboratory.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 382, 218, 398]]<|/det|>
You should:

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 412, 776, 430]]<|/det|>
· complete the diagram in Fig. 4.1 to show the circuit that you would use
